definition: to have children/to raise or bring up/to educate

sentences.english: Hey, that's the economic reality in sports and sports departments today.
sentences.chinese: 嗨，今天体育界和媒体体育部的经济现状就是如此。

sentences.english: In the sporting world, everything is about rankings.
sentences.chinese: 在体育界，一切都与排名有关。

sentences.english: The whole sports world is ringing with the wonderful performances by the twin brothers.
sentences.chinese: 整个体育界盛传着这一对孪生兄弟的出色表演。

sentences.english: In addition to his media empire, Murdoch also owns stakes in the sporting industry.
sentences.chinese: 除了媒体帝国之外，默多克也在体育界有自己的股票。

sentences.english: Some people say the Chinese sportswomen do better than the Chinese sportsmen.
sentences.chinese: 人们都说中国体育界阴盛阳衰。

sentences.english: This might be one of the best sports stories of the year.
sentences.chinese: 这也许是今年体育界的一段佳话了。

sentences.english: News News that is happening around the site and in the world of sports.
sentences.chinese: 新闻资讯，而在工地附近，在体育界发生的事情。

sentences.english: FAO has united with the popular world of professional sport.
sentences.chinese: 粮农组织与广受欢迎的职业体育界同心协力。

sentences.english: The ascension of assistant coaches from winning sports teams to head coach happens all the time.
sentences.chinese: 在体育界，助理教练经常会升为总教练。

sentences.english: A sports personality was invited to kick off at the final.
sentences.chinese: 一位体育界的著名人士被邀请来为决赛开球。

definition: abbr. for 奧林匹克運動會|奥林匹克运动会/Olympic Games/the Olympics
Deng Yaping (1973-), table tennis player, several times world and Olympic winner
Liu Xiang (1983-), Chinese gold-medal hurdler of the 2004 Olympic Games
Jenny Lang Ping (1960-), Chinese volleyball player, coach of USA women's national team since 2005
